Senior HR Consultant

Company Name recoveriescorp Company Location Collins Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 95 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About us:

We are a market leader in Debt Collection and Insurance Claims Recovery. At recoveriescorp, we believe our people are our most valuable asset. Our individual and collective behaviours influence the way in which we interact with colleagues, clients and the broader community. Our culture is anchored around our \xa0values: Willing, Ethical, Courageous, Accountable, Respectful, Exceptional. By living these values we achieve excellence in everything we do. We constantly strive to be the number one provider to our clients and our proven success makes us proud.

\xa0

The role:

We now have an opportunity for an experienced and results orientated HR Consultant to play a pivotal role in our People, Performance & Culture team. The role will see you providing high quality, business focused and operational HR advice and services to teams across the organisation and working closely with key stakeholders to support our desired culture.

\xa0

You will be responsible for:

\xa0

  • Providing advice on HR policies and procedures, HR frameworks and Occupational Health and Safety policies and frameworks.
  • Providing advice and direction on industrial relations and employment legislation, including relevant awards.
  • Coaching and supporting leaders in handling people management and employee relations issues in mitigating the risks to the business.
  • Developing and delivering strategic employee engagement and retention initiatives across the business.
  • Driving the strategic plan of the People, Performance and Culture team.
  • Ensuring all staff are familiar with company policies and procedures and behave accordingly.
  • Preparing and analyse monthly statistical reports relevant to staff levels and turnover.

\xa0

To be considered for this role you will have:

\xa0

  • Tertiary Qualifications in Human Resources or other related discipline.
  • Demonstrated working experience in interpreting and coaching others on employment regulations/law, award and relevant legislation.
  • Previous working experience in the development, interpretation and communication of workplace policies.
  • Ability to build open, mutually respectful and trusting stakeholder relationships.
  • Strong negotiation and influencing skills to gain acceptance of ideas.
  • High level of self-awareness, emotional intelligence and resilience.
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to evaluate and interpret data and information.
  • A high level of flexibility, adaptability and openness to change.
  • Experience implementing a HRIS (desired).


Benefits:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Central CBD location in a unique heritage listed building
  • Income protection insurance (eligible once completed probation)
  • An opportunity to be part of a growing organisation


If this sounds like your next role please apply today.


\xa0

At recoveriescorp we actively celebrate diversity across our workforce and we are committed to providing inclusive and equal employment opportunities to all candidates. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; people from culturally diverse backgrounds; people with disabilities and all members of the LGBTQI community.

House Supervisor

Company Name Department of Health & Human Services, Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 36 views

Job description

Job Description

The Department of Health and Human Services develops and delivers policies, programs and services that support and enhance the wellbeing of all Victorians. Our services are in line with the government's vision for making Victoria a stronger, more caring and innovative state. Our vision is to achieve the best health, wellbeing and safety of all Victorians so that they can live a life they value. We are building an inclusive workplace that embraces diversity of backgrounds and differences to realise the potential of our employees for innovation and delivering services aimed at enhancing the lives of vulnerable Victorians. The department is committed to the safety of its clients. The department takes a zero tolerance approach to abuse, including child abuse and abuse of people with disability. Departmental employees are required to comply with all legal requirements including the Child Safe Standards to keep children safe from harm and abuse. All jobs can be worked flexibly and we encourage job applications from Aboriginal people, people with disabilities, LGBTI and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. If you want a career within a department striving to make Victoria the best place to be and helping shape communities we all want to be part of, then we encourage you to apply. If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander applicant, or if you have a disability, and require advice and support with the recruitment process, contact our Diversity Unit on DiversityInclusion@dhhs.vic.gov.au. The department has a zero tolerance towards violence within the workplace and recognises the rights of all staff to be free from violence and gender-related discrimination. We are proudly working with White Ribbon to create a safer workplace.

Number of vacancies available: 1

Office Location(s): Hume Moreland Area

Position Summary

This role independently delivers or supervises services that support people with disabilities, across their lifecycle and in all domains of life, to enable access to a quality life with dignity, respect and social inclusion, in the least restrictive environment.

Are you
  • Able to lead a team to provide exceptional support services
  • A person with strong leadership qualities
  • An effective communicator as liaising with stakeholders including health care providers, educational facilities and non-government organisations


How To Apply

Applicants are encouraged to apply online, submitting a cover letter and a current resume.

Please Note

For this role, you are not required to address each of the key selection criteria in a separate written document. Applicants are strongly encouraged to review our Careers Page . This page provides information on the department's recruitment and safety screening processes.

Click 'Apply Now' below to submit your interest in this role.

For further information please visit the Department of Health and Human Services website: https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/

Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Government Administration
  • Hospital & Health Care

Product Owner Digital Services

Company Name Property Exchange Australia Ltd (PEXA) Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 264 views

Job description


PRODUCT OWNER
WORKING AT PEXA
A career at PEXA is an exciting, challenging and rewarding experience. We believe our people are what make PEXA such a great place to work. Our culture is centered on innovation, collaboration and making a difference. We are in an extremely exciting period of growth and we'd love for you to be a part of it. We offer a diverse range of employee benefits and rewards, the ability to grow your career through continuous learning and development, and a modern and vibrant office space in a fantastic city location.

THE ROLE
This position will be responsible for maximizing the value of assigned Products or Product Features and maximising the work of supporting Delivery Squads. As a product owner, you will own the entire product. Your focus will be to drive and maintain the success of the product-by ensuring that it offers a strong value proposition to our customers and users; and that it creates the desired benefits for our business. Overall accountability for driving a robust effective and market responsive capability to evolve the Digital Services area in line with PEXA Group and industry expectations while maintaining stability and trust in the network. Cost and quality management of the product. Key to this role is your desire to own and follow through on the vision for what is to be built and your ability to drive delivery of assigned products.

WHAT YOU'RE GOING TO BE DOING
* Define roadmaps and support the team in translating these into well-structured user stories.
* Provide leadership in the execution of a collaborative, dynamic planning and delivery process;
* Help the squads to work in a rational sequence and follow a rational approach with a reasonable probability of delivering value according to Product Owner priorities and team-defined and owned timeframes.
* Enable the completion and release of potentially shippable increments every sprint; maximises opportunities to get regular customer feedback.
* Attach a success metric to every product backlog item and review value delivery at every phase
* Create user stories and success criteria
* Observing, learning about, contacting and analysing customers and end users of the product.
* Sharing insights throughout the company regarding the product (micro-blogging, blogging, internal conferences, etc.).
* Participating in agile stand-ups, retrospectives and showcases
* Instilling a culture of quality and customer focus across all product planning and development activities

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
* A result driven, 'can do' attitude - passionate about getting your hands dirty, driving results and continuous improvement.
* A team player who embraces challenges, handles issues with an open mind and provides well thought through solutions.
* Strong knowledge of Agile principles and practices
* Strong leadership skills with experience influencing & negotiating with high level stakeholders and team members
* Ability to build solid and prosperous relationships with key stakeholders across multiple lines of business and diverse geographies.
* Ability and desire to mentor and support team members to ensure the agile capabilities scale appropriately based on project demands.
* Technical knowledge and hands-on experience in a highly distributed & integrated technology environment.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to develop, lead and motivate a team through relationship management and collaboration
* Strong prioritisation and organisational ability

WHAT NEXT?
If this looks like the role for you, we'd love to hear from you, so apply today!

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Banking
  • Computer Software
  • Information Technology and Services

Employment Type

Contract

Job Functions

  • Information Technology
  • Product Management
]

Senior Digital Project Manager

Company Name Amadeus Group Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 223 views

Job description

ABOUT THE ORGANISATION

Our client is a highly successful ASX listed retailer with multiple stores across Australia and New Zealand. They've developed a market leading position through continuous improvement and a relentless drive for growth and like all great organisations an even bigger hunger and drive for the customer. Renowned for their service and broad product range, they're loved by Aussie households and have barely put a foot wrong in an incredible journey. People are at the heart of their business, the Managing Director knows everyone by first name and they have the lowest staff turnover in the industry for the size of their head count. Built on integrity, respect for one another and team work they constantly challenge each other and innovate to stay ahead of the competition. What lies ahead is arguably their biggest challenge in a full scale digital transformation and you could be part of that legacy. \xa0


ABOUT THE ROLE

The Senior Digital Project Manager (PM) role is responsible for the coordination, implementation, execution, control and completion of digital projects that form part of enterprise wide programs of work. This role will report to the PMO lead and be assigned to work with tech / product leads on customer facing digital platforms.

\xa0

The PM will work to standards, methodologies, procedures and guidelines defined under a newly formed PMO. The PM will work closely with the Programme Leads, Omni channel UX Leads and other primary stakeholders to ensure project objectives and outcomes are delivered with consistency and within the constraints of agreed budget, schedule and quality.

\xa0KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

\xa0

  • Stakeholder management, creating transparency and governance
  • Work closely with the development agency partner or IT to deliver solutions
  • Create and/or contribute to essential project artefacts e.g. mandates, briefs, business cases
  • Lead the planning, implementation and close of a project
  • Facilitate the definition of project scope, goals and deliverables
  • Define project tasks and resource requirements
  • Estimate total project effort and cost and manage project budget
  • Develop full scale project plans
  • Assemble and coordinate project staff
  • Manage project resource allocation
  • Track project deliverables using appropriate tools
  • Provide direction and support to project team
  • Quality assurance (against agreed acceptance criteria and KPIs)
  • Constantly monitor and report on progress of the project to all stakeholders
  • Present reports defining project progress, problems and solutions
  • Implement and manage project changes and interventions to achieve project outputs
  • Project evaluations and assessment of results e.g. lessons learned, post implementation reviews

\xa0

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

\xa0

  • 15+ years of demonstrated experience leading large cross-functional digital projects in a complex organisation

  • Experience in business and digital transformation environments

  • Retail and eCommerce experience prefable but not essential

  • Salary circa 180K-200K package


To apply for any of this unique and exciting position, submit your CV by pushing the APPLY button or for a confidential discussion, contact\xa0 Campbell Butterss at campbellbutterss@amadeusgroup.com.au\xa0


Please note, Amadeus Group are the retained partner for these roles and are conducting a comprehensive search.\xa0

853426384:
[

Settlements Officer

Company Name Fingo Finance Pty Ltd Company Location Moorabbin, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 158 views

Job description

Are you someone who prides yourself on providing high levels of customer service? Do you have excellent administrative skills paying attention to detail and accuracy? Do you enjoy working as part of a team in a fast-paced environment? Can you juggle multiple tasks and conflicting priorities? If you have answered yes, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Settlements team!

We are looking for a tenacious and enthusiastic personality to provide a high quality of customer service to all new and existing clients. We pride ourselves on having a fun team environment, where anyone wishing to excel in the many different aspects of our business has multiple opportunities to progress in their career.

About the role:

  • A high-volume role which requires strong attention to detail.
  • Preparation and review of financial documentation ensuring all details are accurate and complete
  • Reviewing and processing incoming loan contracts accurately
  • Identifying inconsistencies with customer documentation and information provided
  • Ensure compliance with the customers Service Level Agreement
  • Entering of data to ensure seamless settlement and set ups with lenders
  • Communicating with various internal and external stakeholders to solve queries
  • Liaising with sales consultants regarding their queries
  • Communicating issues with settlement documents to internal and external stakeholders
  • Have a good understanding of credit policy and cross train in this area to be proficient in credit
  • Reviewing finance applications to ensure compliance and developing client contracts
  • Processing settlements and inputting client loans into our CRM

About you:

To be successful in this role, you will have previous experience in Customer Service, Financial Services or in a previous settlements position. You will also be: \xa0

  • An eagle eye with detail and accuracy
  • Be able to work under pressure and work to tight deadlines
  • Relish working in a fast paced team environment
  • Have strong processing skills with a focus on accuracy
  • Motivated to learn
  • Strong in numerical and time management skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to liaise with internal and external staff
  • A customer service focus – you naturally know how to provide a first-class experience
  • Fun and vibrant!

Benefits and Culture

Enjoy working in a professional and friendly environment, conveniently located next to crossfit, gyms, and southland shopping centre.

Our culture is to be in a continuous learning environment, be experts in our field, but still have fun! \xa0We provide ongoing training and development, recognize hard work and are big on team culture.

We offer good remuneration and salary packaging benefits, we also provide cars and finance at wholesale prices to employees.

About us

Since 2004 we have been working to become Australia's leader in\xa0car finance, car buying (LMCT 11436) and fleet management for personal and business clients.

We are achieving this by providing outstanding commitment to the specific needs of each individual client through continuous improvement and innovation in the driving factors that influence their buying decisions.

We are committed to service excellence, employee engagement and innovation.

We are seeking people with an "I can do Attitude", if that is you we would love to hear from you!

Please attach a cover letter along with your resume and tell us why you'd love to join our growing team!
